title: Was Russia ready for WWI? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Russia industrialized later than Western Europe so she had fewer factories, fewer railroads and fewer modern weapons. Germany was afraid that Russia would rearm (to German standards) in a few more years. Then it would be impossible to beat Russia in battle. Germany struck early while it still had the advantage. With fewer railways, the Russian Army struggled to move beans and bullets to the front lines.
